episodes.title: Epstein Files Released: Survivor Rina Oh Speaks Out In Exclusive Conversation With Times Now
episodes.description:
The US Department of Justice has released the first batch of long-pending documents linked to investigations into the criminal activities of convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Nearly three lakh pages have been made public following a court-imposed deadline, after months of pressure on US President Donald Trump from both within his party and the opposition.
The documents contain very few direct references to Donald Trump. However, former US President Bill Clinton is mentioned repeatedly, along with several global celebrities including Diana Ross, Mick Jagger and Michael Jackson. The files also name other high-profile individuals such as Britain’s Prince Andrew, his former wife Sarah Ferguson, actor Kevin Spacey and British businessman Richard Branson.
The Justice Department said the release of the records is expected to shed light on Epstein’s financial links and associations with influential figures. As the disclosures trigger fresh scrutiny, Epstein case survivor Rina OH has spoken out, reacting to the release of the documents and calling for greater accountability in the politically sensitive case.
#timesnow #englishnews #jeffreyepstein #epsteinfiles #rinaho #usdoj #billclinton #princeandrew #highprofilecase #exclusive

episodes.title: 'Fugitive' & 'Fraudman' Nithyananda's Land Scam Sparks Outrage, Bolivia Govt Labels Him A 'Criminal'
episodes.description:
A bizarre circumstance occurred when three indigenous tribes of Nambi Bolivia signed land leases for thousand years with non-existent countries on Earth. It is 6.5 times size of Mumbai, 19 times size of Kolkata and 5.3 times size of Bengaluru. However, The council of Indigenous communities came together and immediately petitioned the Bolivian government, stating that since it is Amazonian land, no independent country can come and claim the land. Meanwhile, Katherine Calderón, Directora General- Bolivia showcasing the image of Nithyananda said, 'The person you see on screen (Nithyananda), through several international-level investigations, has been determined to be a criminal. Watch to know more.


#nithyananda #bolivialandscam #indigenoustribeofbolivia #englishnews #timesnow

episodes.title: Nithyananda's Biggest Land Scam: Fraudster Cons Bolivian Tribes; Will India Drag Him Back?
episodes.description:
Self-styled 'Godman' Nithyananda, who fled India and established the so-called 'United States of Kailasa,' has been exposed! Indigenous tribes from Bolivia's Amazon rainforest were duped into signing land leases with a non-existent country.
#nithyananda #bplivia #amazonrainforest #worldnews #timesnow #kailasa #boliviantribe
